Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

literally: to set (one's) face (in a certain direction); hence: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes in a certain direction, often with the purpose of going there or taking action against it
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing satisfaction
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

literally: children of a town, region, nation; hence: = people, animals, or products that are inhabitants of or originating from a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the offspring of that place
literally: possession; hence: = a group of people that have been subdued by another group of people, which often implies that the conquerors regard the victims as their possession
= causative action by which humans place an object in a certain location with the intention that it will stay there for an extended period of time

= community area of tents or other shelters, sometimes encircled by a barrier such as a stone wall, ► where a pastoral or nomadic people live; ≈ a more temporary and less populated settlement than a town
= temporary construction ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, shepherds, etc.
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
literally: fruit; hence: = products of the land, ◄ depicted as fruit; ≈ regarded as a blessing from God

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= town, also known as Rabbah of the Ammonites (רַב) ◄ and located in Ammon; ► capital of the Ammonite kingdom, first conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) and later again by David (דָּוִד)

= large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= action by which humans strike the palms of their hands together repeatedly ► as an expression of joy

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
literally: to stamp with (one's) foot; hence: = action by which humans bring down their foot with force on the ground or an object ► as an expression of joy

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

= Horite (חֹרִי) clan, named after the man who founded them and bearing the same name as the area they live in; they were later dispossessed by the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי) and it is not always clear from the context whether it refers to the original Horites (חֹרִי) or the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to open (an area); hence: = causative action by which deities allow a certain area to become vulnerable and open to enemy attack
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: shoulder; hence: = side of a mountain or hill
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which someone or something is worthy of honor and respect ◄ because of beauty, power, or fame

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= town; ◄ in the region of Moab (מֹואָב) allotted to the tribe of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= town, also known as Beth Meon (בֵּית מְעֹון) Beth Baal Meon (בֵּית בַּעַל מְעֹון) and Beon (בְּעֹן) ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) and later of Moab (מֹואָב)

literally: children of a town, region, nation; hence: = people, animals, or products that are inhabitants of or originating from a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the offspring of that place
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)
= an area of land that is owned by an individual or group of people, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= difficult circumstances ≈ regarded as a direct punishment from God
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to be guilty|to be in the wrong|to have wronged
Node.definition: = to bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

Node.gloss: to be guilty|to be in the wrong|to have wronged

= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= a place where no one can live, whether as a result of destruction or not
= area; ◄ territory of the most prominent tribe of Edom (אֱדֹום) ; ≈ sometimes used to refer to the entire territory of Edom
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
